sn6.2:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Uruvelā on the bank of the river Nerañjarā at the foot of the Goatherd’s Banyan Tree just after he had become fully enlightened.
sn6.2:1.3: Then, while the Blessed One was alone in seclusion, a reflection arose in his mind thus:
sn6.2:1.4: “One dwells in suffering if one is without reverence and deference. Now what ascetic or brahmin can I honour and respect and dwell in dependence on?”
sn6.2:2.1: Then it occurred to the Blessed One:
sn6.2:2.2: “It would be for the sake of fulfilling an unfulfilled aggregate of virtue that I would honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on another ascetic or brahmin.
sn6.2:2.3: However, in this world with its devas, Māra, and Brahmā, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans, I do not see another ascetic or brahmin more perfect in virtue than myself, whom I could honour and respect and dwell in dependence on.
sn6.2:3.1: “It would be for the sake of fulfilling an unfulfilled aggregate of concentration that I would honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on another ascetic or brahmin.
sn6.2:3.2: However… I do not see another ascetic or brahmin more perfect in concentration than myself… .
sn6.2:4.1: “It would be for the sake of fulfilling an unfulfilled aggregate of wisdom that I would honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on another ascetic or brahmin.
sn6.2:4.2: However… I do not see another ascetic or brahmin more perfect in wisdom than myself… .
sn6.2:5.1: “It would be for the sake of fulfilling an unfulfilled aggregate of liberation that I would honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on another ascetic or brahmin.
sn6.2:5.2: However… I do not see another ascetic or brahmin more perfect in liberation than myself… .
sn6.2:6.1: “It would be for the sake of fulfilling an unfulfilled aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation that I would honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on another ascetic or brahmin.
sn6.2:6.2: I do not see another ascetic or brahmin more perfect in the knowledge and vision of liberation than myself, whom I could honour and respect, and on whom I could dwell in dependence. “Let me then honour, respect, and dwell in dependence on this very Dhamma to which I have fully awakened. ”
sn6.2:7.1: Then, having known with his own mind the reflection in the Blessed One’s mind, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his drawn-in arm or draw in his extended arm, Brahmā Sahampati disappeared from the brahmā world and reappeared before the Blessed One.
sn6.2:7.2: He arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, raised his joined hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One, and said to him:
sn6.2:7.3: “So it is, Blessed One! So it is, Fortunate One!
sn6.2:7.4: Venerable sir, those who were the Arahants, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones in the past—those Blessed Ones too honoured, respected, and dwelt in dependence just on the Dhamma itself.
sn6.2:7.5: Those who will be the Arahants, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones in the future—those Blessed Ones too will honour, respect, and dwell in dependence just on the Dhamma itself.
sn6.2:7.6: Let the Blessed One too, who is at present the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, honour, respect, and dwell in dependence just on the Dhamma itself. ”
sn6.2:7.7: This is what Brahmā Sahampati said. Having said this, he further said this:
sn6.2:8.3: And he who is the Buddha now,
sn6.2:10.3: Should deeply revere the true Dhamma,
